pullrequest.title: Lock subscriberMutex anywhere subscribedNodes is used

content.raw: Narrowed the scope of this lock to avoid a deadlock when this function calls `ConnectSubscribers()`.
content.html: Narrowed the scope of this lock to avoid a deadlock when this function calls ConnectSubscribers().

content.raw: can you pose the backtrace somewhere so I can refer to it in my testing?

pullrequest.title: Lock subscriberMutex anywhere subscribedNodes is used

content.raw:
I set this branch for my overnight `make test` loop. I don't see any new backtraces, which is a good.

I grepped for `/std::map.*TopicManager/` in any 2019 backtraces, and I counted 42 backtraces from the `gz` program being called from `TopicManager::Fini`. The backtraces appear to come from the `UNIT_gz_TEST` calling `gz model -i`. This is failure a rate of about 1 every 2 days. I didn't see one last night, which is also a good sign, though not conclusive. I'll try running the `UNIT_gz_TEST` intensively with gazebo9 and this branch to see if it's a related failure.
content.html:
I set this branch for my overnight make test loop. I don't see any new backtraces, which is a good.

I grepped for /std::map.*TopicManager/ in any 2019 backtraces, and I counted 42 backtraces from the gz program being called from TopicManager::Fini. The backtraces appear to come from the UNIT_gz_TEST calling gz model -i. This is failure a rate of about 1 every 2 days. I didn't see one last night, which is also a good sign, though not conclusive. I'll try running the UNIT_gz_TEST intensively with gazebo9 and this branch to see if it's a related failure.

content.raw: I still see this failure with this branch, so it is likely unrelated
content.html: I still see this failure with this branch, so it is likely unrelated

content.raw: The changes look fine to me. I ran this a few times on jenkins and also noticed  one `UNIT_gz_TEST`  test failure. This time it’s failing in `gzTest.Topic` but looking at the builds in the past, `UNIT_gz_TEST` has been failing in different places so there are definitely problems else where.
